annotation.TEXT: One level left: Vanilla Dome 4.
Now, these plants are tricky enough without having to deal with bullets flying all over the place, so try this:
BGM: DKC2 - In a Snow-Bound Land
BGM: Tetris (Tengen) NES - Karinka
I must've triggered the "turn off generators" sprite that's around here, so I'm trying to trigger the bullet generator again.
There! Now I just have to press the Red Switch and move on to the next point of interest!
Bye, Yoshi!
There are five buzzies and one red parakoopa here, which remains red even though I cleared Funky, so I can't sand cloud the koopa itself, but the buzzies are fair game!
Okay, I'm done here!
There it goes!
I hope I have enough time...
If you don't do this, there's a good chance that the shell-less yellow koopa will commit suicide when he respawns later, and you don't want that!
Speaking of said side area, I'll be coming back to enter it later, since there's things to sand cloud in there!
Huzzah! It worked! The timing has to be perfect for this glitch, but if Yoshi eats a power up just as time expires, it'll cancel out the death!
May as well get the moon while I'm here! Yay, unneeded lives!
Changing to an area with different music corrects the music, and as long as I don't leave the level or eat a green berry, the timer will remain unlimited! I could fool around a bit I guess.
...Funky! That's right. It's necessary to go here before the next Vanilla Dome level.
There are also some cheep-cheeps, but there's no way to sand cloud them, so I'm ignoring them.
Now, as I said before, with generators, I only need to hit one of them. So if I get one sideways Pidgit Bill here, and an upward-shooting bullet later, I'll be all set.
Got 'em, and that's all the targets! But, there's still one more Yoshi Coin, and it's one that I must give up Yoshi to reach (kind of ironic I'd say). This is why I saved this level for last.
You've probably noticed that I'm using a blue shell here. If I hadn't cleared Funky, it would be red, and there's no way I could've reached everything here!
Now I only got four of them, but I can simply leave this side area and enter it again, resetting the room. Then I can easily get the fifth buzzy.
Yep, I'm using this bonus room as a shortcut!
Tricky part here. I want to get to the shell before the koopa gets clobbered by it.
But, at least I gained enough experience to speed run this level quite efficiently now.
The timer in this level used to be an issue, but now I can finish before the "Hurry up!" warning even occurs!
Even, if you know they're coming, it's not always easy. Changing to a platform of a different altitude may help.
That glitch did use up one of my power ups, so I guess I'll pick up this one.
Well, I've hit every target I can, and gotten five Yoshi Coins, but there is a sixth Yoshi Coin, and I'm going to collect it as well.
More useless lives! Also, I want that reserve feather. A cape is required later, so I'll want the back up in case I take a hit.
Alright, I just need to get 1 bonus star and I'm done!
Also, you might want to double-back one extra time, since there may be a koopa that didn't spawn for whatever reason the previous time!
Yep, I'm using the bonus room as a shortcut again! It's really handy!
Death BGM: Castlevania - Lost life
When you see the shell-less yellow koopa, try to get him before he enters the shell again.
Now, unfortunately, Yoshi can't get under a couple of these walls in this area, so...
While not required, having a cape helps a lot, too.
I don't actually have to sand cloud anything here. I only have to clear the level. So I'll just cut straight to the victory march.
Surprisingly, even the Red Switch Palace has a tricky element in it!
Okay, resuming course, the next level is Vanilla Dome 3.
Next, grab the first two coins, and then do the disco dance (keep dodging the rainbow shell like this) until the P-switch expires.
Gulp!
More unreachable enemies. The spike tops up above are too high to sand cloud, so once again, I'm not going to bother with them.
That's everything I can get back here. And no, you can't sand cloud the Blarggs. For some reason, sand clouds won't appear when you jump on a skull raft!
As a bonus, I think I'll show one of my silly failures in Vanilla Dome 3.
And this challenge is complete!
This may come as a surprise, but my next destination is not in the Vanilla Dome! It's...
Gulp!
Now, just make your way to the right, pick any non-red koopa to eat, then start sand-clouding everything!
Umm... Crap! I just realized something, but it's not related to this challenge, so I'll just keep going and finish. (It has to do with something I did last week...)
Double hit!
I think ZSNES hates this level or something. It desynched three of my successful runs here! Needless to say, I was not thrilled!
BGM: DKC2 - Hot-Head Bop
Also, I think I'll pick up another... useless... life...
BGM: The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past - Dark World
Move right until you're a little ways past the second plant, then backtrack to the midway gate, but no further. This should stop the bullets from appearing while you're busy sand-clouding the plants.
You know what? I don't think I'm gonna have enough time for this area! Time to try my last resort move that I recently learned!
Now for that side area...
Most of the buzzies are easy enough, but one falls into the water so fast that I have to use screen-scrolling to reach him in time.
This is helpful so that you don't have unnecessary air traffic while dealing with the previous two koopas.
Once this works, you'll have unlimited time (unless you eat a green berry)! Of course, the music's gone for now, but that's okay.
The surrounding bullets will eventually reappear, so be ready. I still need to hit an upward-shooting one.
BAM! BAM! BAM! BAM! BAM! BAM! BAM! BAM! BAM!
Gulp!
Perfect! But, even if I screwed up, the level can easily be reset using the side area to the left.
If you proceed until about this point, the bullets will stop.
If you can get into just the right position here...
Hmm... That's odd. One of the wall springboards didn't appear!
The last two koopas here can't be hit in their current positions. I have to cape-spin them and catch their shells before I can sand cloud them.
And, actually, I still can't reach everything. That pumpkin plant I just whacked with the shell for instance, is too high to sand cloud, so I'm not going to worry about it.
My next destination is the Red Switch Palace. There are plenty of koopas in there!
Double hit!
Double hit!
And where do you think you're going, Yoshi?
It's because of the rainbow shell at the start. First hit the P-switch while the green koopa is moving to the right.
There's a reason I saved this level until last, but I'll get to that later.
